com.luigisgro.cqf.fdm
Class StaticHedgingStrategy

java.lang.Object
  com.luigisgro.cqf.fdm.StaticHedgingStrategy

public class StaticHedgingStrategy
extends java.lang.Object

High level class representing a trading strategy with static hedging. It is also the access point to run the FDM pricing when used with portfolios with static hedge.

Author:
Luigi Sgro

Constructor Summary
StaticHedgingStrategy(Grid grid, Portfolio portfolio, FiniteDifferenceModel method, double r)
          Creates a new static hedging strategy object
 
Method Summary
 double cost()
          Calculates the cost of the portfolio, typically corresponding to the cost of the hedge by multiplying the unit cost to the position

StaticHedgingStrategy

public StaticHedgingStrategy(Grid grid,
                             Portfolio portfolio,
                             FiniteDifferenceModel method,
                             double r)
Creates a new static hedging strategy object

Parameters:
grid - The grid for FDM
portfolio - The portfolio
method - The Finite Difference method to be used
r - The interest rate
Method Detail

isPrintProgress

public boolean isPrintProgress()
Accessor method for the printProgress parameter

Returns:
True if the print of progress is enabled, false otherwise

setPrintProgress

public void setPrintProgress(boolean printProgress)
Set the print progress

Parameters:
printProgress - True to enable it, false to disable it

getHedgeItems

public Portfolio.Item[] getHedgeItems()
Returns the array of items tagged as hedging instrument, together with their current position

Returns:
An array of Portfolio.Item

getPortfolio

public Portfolio getPortfolio()
The portfolio managed by the strategy

Returns:
The internal Portfolio object

cost

public double cost()
Calculates the cost of the portfolio, typically corresponding to the cost of the hedge by multiplying the unit cost to the position

Returns:
The current cost of the instrument with a price

getValueAt

public double getValueAt(double s)
The present value of the portfolio at stock = s

Parameters:
s - The stock value to be used
Returns:
The value of the portfolio at s

getPnLAt

public double getPnLAt(double s)
Calculates the difference between the overall value of the portfolio according to FDM and the cost of hedging at a specific value of the stock

Parameters:
s - The value of stock
Returns:
The P&L generated by this trading strategy at s. If the derivative to be priced has cost = 0, this correspond to the calculated value of the derivative

runPricing

public boolean runPricing()
Run the FDM to evaluate the portfolio

Returns:
True if the pricing succeeded, false otherwise

hedgePositions

public double[] hedgePositions()
Returns an array containing the position of each hedging instrument, in the same order as they have been added to the strategy

Returns:
An array of hedging instrument positions

hedgePositionsDesc

public java.lang.String hedgePositionsDesc()
Utility method to allow a pretty print

Returns:
A string representing the current position of the hedge instruments
